metadata.query: What are the skills of Josh Denziel

results.text:
Josh Denziel S. Joves
2309 Cisne St., Pandacan, Manila.
+63 949 997 3474 | Denz.joves@gmail.com
results.context: Contact details for Josh Denziel S. Joves

results.text:
PERSONAL SKILLS

● Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
● Skilled in designing system architecture and technical solutions
● Detail oriented with ability to identify functional gaps
● Eﬀective leader and team motivator
results.context: List of personal skills and attributes

results.text:
SKILLS & ABILITIES

Technical Skills: Java, C++, JavaScript, PHP, MySQL, Kotlin, C#, ASP.NET, AngularJs, React, Express.js, Node.js, MongoDB, Python, Django, FastAPI, Laravel, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Tailwind CSS
results.context: List of technical skills and programming languages

results.text:
ACHIEVEMENTS/RESPONSIBILITY

● Led the development of a logistics company web application integrating Agentic AI with LLM capabilities for knowledge base querying, AI assistant task automation, and dynamic data mapping and entry. Utilized Python, LangChain, LangGraph, and OpenAI LLM and embedding models as Capstone Project (currently in development).
● Served as Project Manager for a bakeshop attendance and salary computation web application using the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js)
results.context: Key projects and leadership roles undertaken

CAREER OBJECTIVE

A graduating student committed to learning industry best practices, including end-to-end development processes, client requirement analysis, and technology-driven problem solving. Seeks a role that cultivates technical depth, leadership capability, and eager hands-on experience while supporting initiatives involving artiﬁcial intelligence and modern application architectures. Aims to build a strong foundation in solution design and system architecture as part of a long-term career in the technology ﬁeld.

with clients and partners must be professional, cooperative, and focused on solving their

● *Confidentiality: All company information, client data, inventory details, pricing*
structures, and operational strategies are strictly confidential and must not be disclosed
to unauthorized parties.


</s> <s=13> *3.2 Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE)*


</s> <s=11> Due to the nature of logistics, strict adherence to HSE protocols is mandatory.


● *Zero-Accident Policy: All personnel are required to follow safety procedures, wear*
appropriate Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) in designated areas (e.g.,
warehouses, yards), and report all hazards, near-misses, and incidents immediately.
● *Compliance: All transport operations must strictly adhere to local and national traffic*
laws and regulations. All warehouse operations must comply with industry safety
standards, particularly for Cold, Temperature-Controlled, and Ambient storage.

● *Commitment: Through operational excellence, sustainable practices, and a culture of*
accountability, we ensure the safe, efficient handling of diverse products in full
compliance with all regulations.
● *Leadership: Our management leads by example, fostering continual improvement in our*
*Quality Management System to achieve accuracy, customer-centricity, and getting it*
*right the first time in every step of the supply chain.*

operational values:

colleagues, the cargo, and company assets.

● *Distribution: Personnel must o

● Dispatch: Switch to manual dispatch procedures using pre-printed Delivery Order (DO) and Bill of Lading (BOL) forms. Log all movements via secure chat groups.
● Warehouse: Halt all non-critical picking/packing. Receiving must be done manually, creating handwritten Receiving Reports. No movement of High-Value Cargo without dual sign-off.
● Data: Once systems are restored, all manual records must be prioritized for data entry to meet RPO of 12 hours for WMS data.

results.text:
<s=13> *4.2 Fire and Emergency Evacuation*


</s> <s=11> ● *All employees must be familiar with the Site Evacuation Plan, assembly points, and the*


location of fire extinguishers.


● *Fire Drills must be conducted at least annually.*


● In the event of a fire, the priority is to sound the alarm, evacuate, and only attempt to


fight the fire if trained to do so and if the fire is small and contained.


</s> <s=13> *4.3 First Aid*


</s> <s=11> ● First aid kits are maintained in designated, easily accessible areas (e.g., Office, Dispatch


Center, Warehouse Office).


● *A list of certified First Aiders for each shift must be posted publicly.*
</s>

<s=13> *_ 3.0 Control Checklists (Receiving/Dispatch Checklist) _*


</s> <s=11> _●_ _[ ] ASN/DO verified against physical shipment._
_●_ _[ ] Total Piece Count verified (Tally vs. BOL)._
_●_ _[ ] Cargo inspected for damage (Pass/Fail)._
_●_ _[ ] WMS entry completed and System Receiving Report generated._
_●_ _[ ] Discrepancy logged and resolution confirmed (if applicable)._
_●_ _[ ] Final put-away scan confirmed in WMS._
</s>

</s> <s=11> *Right of Way: Pedestrians always have the right-of-way and must use designated* •
</s> <s=12> walkways.


</s> <s=11> *Pre-Operation Checks: Forklifts must be inspected prior to every shift.* •
</s>

[PAGE=2]
<s=11> *Racking Limits: Never exceed the documented maximum load capacity of the* •
</s> <s=12> racking system.


</s> <s=11> *Pallet Safety

nd site
safety clearance. | HR Manager
[/TABLE]
</s>

[PAGE=3]
<s=13> *_ 4.0 Disaster Scenario: Major Power and Network Outage _*


</s> <s=11> *_ 4.1 Response and Activation _*


_1._ *_ Immediate Action: IC to declare Level 2 (Major Disruption). _*
_2._ *_ Communication: Activate satellite/backup communication devices. Notify all critical _*
_personnel via SMS/alternative channel._
_3._ *_ WMS/IT: IT Lead immediately switches to off-site cloud servers (if applicable) or initiates _*
*_ Backup & Recovery Procedure (Refer to IT Manual). _*


*_ 4.2 Logistics Continuity Protocol _*


_●_ *_ Dispatch: Switch to manual dispatch procedures using pre-printed Delivery Order (DO) _*
*_ and Bill of Lading (BOL) forms. Log all movements via secure chat groups. _*
_●_ *_ Warehouse: Halt all non-critical picking/packing. Receiving must be done manually, _*
*_ creating handwritten Receiving Reports. No movement of High-Value Cargo without _*
_dual sign-off._
_●_ *_ Data: Once systems are restored,

nd site
safety clearance. | HR Manager
[/TABLE]
</s>

2.0 Critical Business Functions (CBFs) and Recovery Objectives
results.section_title: Critical Business Functions (CBFs) and Recovery Objectives
results.context: Overview of critical business functions and recovery objectives

results.text:
must perform a Daily Vehicle Inspection Report (DVIR) before operating any*


company vehicle. Any defects must be reported and corrected before departure.


● *No use of mobile phones or electronic devices while the vehicle is in motion.*


</s> <s=13> *3.2 Fatigue Management*


</s> <s=11> ● Drivers must adhere strictly to mandated driving hours and rest periods to prevent


fatigue-related accidents.


● Drivers must report any physical signs of excessive fatigue immediately and pull over


safely.


</s> <s=17> *SECTION 4: EMERGENCY RESPONSE & REPORTING*


</s> <s=13> *4.1 Accident and Incident Reporting (Refer to Incident/Accident Report*


*Forms)*
</s>

[PAGE=4]
<s=11> ● *_ All injuries, illnesses, accidents, property damage, and near-misses (events that could _*


have caused harm) must be reported immediately to the supervisor and HSE Officer.


● *An investigation must be conducted for every incident to determine the root cause and*


implement preventative measures.


</s>

The primary objective of this BCDR Plan is to minimize the impact of unforeseen events (natural disasters, system failures, power outages, etc.) on our core logistics services (Safety, Quality, Delivery). We commit to the protection of personnel, client cargo, and vital business data, ensuring an acceptable level of service continuity.
results.context: Objectives of the BCDR Plan to ensure service continuity
